intro: Anaphalis zeylanica, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and fluffy, cloud-like inflorescences that resemble miniature clouds. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Anaphalis zeylanica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
